etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in William Healey Dall (1845–1927), natural historian, paleontologist, and malacologist

definitions: designating a complex form of toothed hinge found in shells of bivalve molluscs (rare).

designating the largest form of the mandibles occurring in certain beetles, especially male stag beetles (family Lucanidae), or a beetle bearing such mandibles; contrasted with mesodont and "priodont".
